intro: Pilosella curvescens, commonly known as the bent-leaved hawk's-beard, is a flowering plant in the Asteraceae family. It is native to Europe and parts of Asia, typically found in meadows and grasslands. The plant has hairy stems and leaves that are often curved or twisted, giving it its common name. Its yellow flowers are arranged in a composite head, typical of the daisy family. Pilosella curvescens is generally hardy and can thrive in a variety of soil conditions.
